commit_message:
Compute API Hypervisor Tests.

Adds tests for compute hypervisor API.

Change-Id: Id7df5a43ff899f23269c8ad5067c0bf6483b1d8a
Partially-Implements: blueprint initial-tests-compute
Co-Authored-By: Chi Lo <cl566n@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michael Sliem <ms272s@att.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/12/431112/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2017 AT&T Corporation. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import config from tempest.lib.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.lib import decorators from patrole_tempest_plugin import rbac_rule_validation from patrole_tempest_plugin.rbac_utils import rbac_utils from patrole_tempest_plugin.tests.api.compute import rbac_base CONF = config.CONF class KeypairsRbacTest(rbac_base.BaseV2ComputeRbacTest): @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(KeypairsRbacTest, cls).setup_clients() cls.client = cls.keypairs_client @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(KeypairsRbacTest, cls).skip_checks() if not CONF.compute_feature_enabled.api_extensions: raise cls.skipException( '%s skipped as no compute extensions enabled' % cls.__name__) def tearDown(self): rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=False) super(KeypairsRbacTest, self).tearDown() def _create_keypair(self): name = data_utils.rand_name('keypair') keypair = self.client.create_keypair(name=name) return keypair['keypair'] @decorators.idempotent_id('a57073f9-5a9e-4476-8f45-f0302fff83db') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-keypairs:index") def test_list_keypairs(self): rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.list_keypairs() @decorators.idempotent_id('d6853324-e02b-4a70-be34-6a125bb57997') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-keypairs:create") def test_create_keypair(self): rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self._create_keypair() @decorators.idempotent_id('d90e2e64-9e71-4a97-a428-b9dba4d00b95') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-keypairs:delete") def test_delete_keypair(self): keypair = self._create_keypair() rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.delete_keypair(keypair_name=keypair['name']) @decorators.idempotent_id('ad6582a1-7c58-4deb-88ba-7e2e917aede7') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-keypairs:show") def test_show_keypair(self): keypair = self._create_keypair() rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.show_keypair(keypair_name=keypair['name'])

commit_message:
Rebranding of Eqlx to Dell EMC PS Series

This changes rebrands Dell Eqlx to Dell PS series
and matches the tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: I3536147a06b426ace18cf415e99361c47b4cf5d9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/31/430331/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'with only dellps' do :cinder_enable_dellps_backend => true, it 'should configure only dellps' do is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::dellps') :enabled_backends => ['tripleo_dellps'] ) end end context 'with only scaleio' do before :each do params.merge!({ :cinder_enable_scaleio_backend => true, :cinder_enable_iscsi_backend => false, }) end it 'should configure only scaleio' do is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::scaleio') is_expected.to_not contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::iscsi') is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume') is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::cinder') is_expected.to contain_class('cinder::volume') is_expected.to contain_class('cinder::backends').with( :enabled_backends => ['tripleo_scaleio'] is_expected.to_not contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::dellps') is_expected.to_not contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::scaleio') :cinder_enable_dellps => true, :cinder_enable_scaleio => true, is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::dellps') is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::scaleio') :enabled_backends => ['tripleo_iscsi', 'tripleo_ceph', 'tripleo_dellps', 'tripleo-scaleio','tripleo_dellsc', 'tripleo_netapp', 'tripleo_nfs']
deleted_lines: context 'with only eqlx' do :cinder_enable_eqlx_backend => true, it 'should configure only eqlx' do is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::eqlx') :enabled_backends => ['tripleo_eqlx'] is_expected.to_not contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::eqlx') :cinder_enable_eqlx_backend => true, is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::eqlx') :enabled_backends => ['tripleo_iscsi', 'tripleo_ceph', 'tripleo_eqlx', 'tripleo_dellsc', 'tripleo_netapp','tripleo_nfs']

commit_message:
Introduce os-capability parsing

This patch introduces a way to parse cpuset information by looking
into the 'lscpu' output. The implementation is presently done for
linux but given docker or some such container runtimes can work on
other operating systems too, a more generic approach has been taken.

Eventually host_capabilities module should expose general purpose
methods leaving the details of the os inside the respective dir.

Change-Id: I0f92594d8e5ce013f47174c09bc941ea1de3f0a8

added_lines: # Copyright 2017 IBM Corp # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from collections import defaultdict from oslo_log import log as logging import re import six import subprocess from zun.common.i18n import _LE from zun.container.os_capability import host_capability LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class LinuxHost(host_capability.Host): def get_cpu_numa_info(self): # TODO(sbiswas7): rootwrap changes for zun required. try: output = subprocess.check_output(['lscpu', "-p=socket,cpu,online"]) except Exception as e: LOG.exception(_LE("There was a problem while executing lscpu: %s"), six.text_type(e)) cpu_sock_pair = re.findall("\d+(?:,\d+,[Y/N])?", str(output)) sock_map = defaultdict(list) for value in cpu_sock_pair: val = value.split(",") if len(val) == 3 and val[2] == 'Y': sock_map[val[0]].append(val[1]) return sock_map

subject: Use RDO/UCA everywhere
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-10 11:15:07.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/pre_install.yml', 'vars/redhat.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/use-uca-everywhere-4be33314d01c8545.yaml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install/commit/d189881d5472922161028e6a0f3ec1d457e2a8e2', 'message': "Use RDO/UCA everywhere

The pip_install role installs binary dependencies, like python-openssl
(on Ubuntu), or pyOpenSSL (on Centos).

By default, we didn't configure extra sources (like UCA or RDO)
in the pip_install role. Because the repo is built using UCA or RDO
(current default), we could have inconsistency issues:
containers that haven't UCA or RDO applied during their role execution
would run with a venv packaged for a different python-openssl
(or python-cryptography).

This commit brings the consistency by installing UCA/RDO everywhere.

Closes-Bug: 1624791

Change-Id: I9b5cd40b2972c93af348d4ddfde21a038cf9becc

(Manually cherry picked from commit

"}]
commit_message:
Use RDO/UCA everywhere

The pip_install role installs binary dependencies, like python-openssl
(on Ubuntu), or pyOpenSSL (on Centos).

By default, we didn't configure extra sources (like UCA or RDO)
in the pip_install role. Because the repo is built using UCA or RDO
(current default), we could have inconsistency issues:
containers that haven't UCA or RDO applied during their role execution
would run with a venv packaged for a different python-openssl
(or python-cryptography).

This commit brings the consistency by installing UCA/RDO everywhere.

Closes-Bug: 1624791

Change-Id: I9b5cd40b2972c93af348d4ddfde21a038cf9becc
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(Manually cherry picked from commit
fe4fa1882229c22478357c82a71a4227d868b8c5)

pxe_ssh is not enabled by default anumore and is deprecated.

commit_message:
undercloud upgrade: stop httpd

httpd needs to be in the list of things we want to stop because it runs
OpenStack APIs.

For example, in Ocata we are removing Nova API in WSGI and run in
eventlet again like it was done in Mitaka.

Change-Id: I610fbf1373363bab107d52b9085081b6de11f58d

commit_message:
Disable swap-volume in tempest when ceph is used

Ceph doesn't support volume swapping so disable that feature in
tempest.

Change-Id: I8f3da1d730113b100526662ba7ec71f603ab36da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph refs/changes/42/432342/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add start_version check for do_list() image_metadata option

The image_metadata options requires Cinder API v3.4, but
user can specify this option before API v3.4 then the
option will be ignored without any warning message.

We should check this option using start_version to
avoid confusion.

Change-Id: I6983494cb6653a9eaf35f4eedba87aeb70b55260

subject: Add --metadata option to API v2 cinder list command again
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-01 19:25:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/dd4ae0c375d3c8859772f11abdd7712b741203b8', 'message': 'Add --metadata option to API v2 cinder list command again

--metadata option of do_list() in v2/shell.py was
unexpectedly removed and --image_metadata option was
added instead of --metadata option.

This is wrong fix because --image_metadata option
requires API version >= "3.4" and is not supported at
API v2. On the other hands, --metadata option of

We should remove --image_metadata option and then add

be fixed because this doesn't require API >=3.4.

commit_message:
Add --metadata option to API v2 cinder list command again

In the commit I90a2b713556e91db69270a03ef6b798e08f93f90,
--metadata option of do_list() in v2/shell.py was
unexpectedly removed and --image_metadata option was
added instead of --metadata option.

This is wrong fix because --image_metadata option
requires API version >= "3.4" and is not supported at
API v2. On the other hands, --metadata option of
do_list() is supported from API v1.

We should remove --image_metadata option and then add
--metadata option to do_list() again.

Also comment on API v3 cinder list --metadata should
be fixed because this doesn't require API >=3.4.

Co-Authored-By: Masaki Kimura <masaki.kimura.kz@hitachi.com>

Change-Id: Ic7d5cfa2acb47fbf73776e034d958ad8fb9119a8
Closes-Bug: #1661045
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/75/427875/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _extract_metadata(args): metadata = {} for metadatum in args.metadata: # unset doesn't require a val, so we have the if/else if '=' in metadatum: (key, value) = metadatum.split('=', 1) else: key = metadatum value = None metadata[key] = value return metadata @utils.arg('--metadata', 'metadata': _extract_metadata(args) if args.metadata else None,
deleted_lines: @utils.arg('--image_metadata', 'glance_metadata': shell_utils.extract_metadata(args, type='image_metadata') if args.image_metadata else None,

commit_message:
Adds network check in upgrade phase in devstack

When running grenade with multitenancy, we are able to boot instances
in the network neutron has created in its upgrade phase, and we don't
have to change that setup.

Change-Id: I1038548ad4f93788fca3e2b7dd8ed93da0ce7702
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/43/428043/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If use multitenancy if [[ -z "${IRONIC_PROVISION_NETWORK_NAME}" ]]; then # Ironic needs to have network access to the instance during deployment # from the control plane (ironic-conductor). This 'early_create' function # creates a new network with a unique CIDR, adds a route to this network # from ironic-conductor and creates taps between br-int and brbm. # ironic-conductor will be able to access the ironic nodes via this new # network. # TODO(vsaienko) use OSC when Neutron commands are supported in the stable # release. local net_id net_id=$(openstack network create --share $NEUTRON_NET -f value -c id) resource_save network net_id $net_id local subnet_params="" subnet_params+="--ip_version 4 " subnet_params+="--gateway $RESOURCES_NETWORK_GATEWAY " subnet_params+="--name $NEUTRON_NET " subnet_params+="$net_id $RESOURCES_FIXED_RANGE" local subnet_id subnet_id=$(neutron subnet-create $subnet_params | grep ' id ' | get_field 2) resource_save network subnet_id $subnet_id local router_id router_id=$(openstack router create $NEUTRON_NET -f value -c id) resource_save network router_id $router_id neutron router-interface-add $NEUTRON_NET $subnet_id neutron router-gateway-set $NEUTRON_NET public # NOTE(vsaeinko) sleep is needed in order to setup route sleep 5 # Add a route to the baremetal network via the Neutron public router. # ironic-conductor will be able to access the ironic nodes via this new # route. local r_net_gateway # Determine the IP address of the interface (ip -4 route get 8.8.8.8) that # will be used to access a public IP on the router we created ($router_id). # In this case we use the Google DNS server at 8.8.8.8 as the public IP # address. This does not actually attempt to contact 8.8.8.8, it just # determines the IP address of the interface that traffic to 8.8.8.8 would # use. We use the IP address of this interface to setup the route. r_net_gateway=$(sudo ip netns exec qrouter-$router_id ip -4 route get 8.8.8.8 |grep dev | awk '{print $7}') sudo ip route replace $RESOURCES_FIXED_RANGE via $r_net_gateway # NOTE(vsaienko) remove connection between br-int and brbm from old setup sudo ovs-vsctl -- --if-exists del-port ovs-1-tap1 sudo ovs-vsctl -- --if-exists del-port brbm-1-tap1 create_ovs_taps $net_id fi if [[ -z "${IRONIC_PROVISION_NETWORK_NAME}" ]]; then # NOTE(vsaienko) move ironic VMs back to private network. local net_id net_id=$(openstack network show private -f value -c id) create_ovs_taps $net_id neutron router-gateway-clear neutron_grenade || /bin/true neutron router-interface-delete neutron_grenade neutron_grenade || /bin/true neutron router-delete neutron_grenade || /bin/true neutron net-delete neutron_grenade || /bin/true fi
deleted_lines: # Ironic needs to have network access to the instance during deployment # from the control plane (ironic-conductor). This 'early_create' function # creates a new network with a unique CIDR, adds a route to this network # from ironic-conductor and creates taps between br-int and brbm. # ironic-conductor will be able to access the ironic nodes via this new # network. # TODO(vsaienko) use OSC when Neutron commands are supported in the stable # release. local net_id net_id=$(openstack network create --share $NEUTRON_NET -f value -c id) resource_save network net_id $net_id local subnet_params="" subnet_params+="--ip_version 4 " subnet_params+="--gateway $RESOURCES_NETWORK_GATEWAY " subnet_params+="--name $NEUTRON_NET " subnet_params+="$net_id $RESOURCES_FIXED_RANGE" local subnet_id subnet_id=$(neutron subnet-create $subnet_params | grep ' id ' | get_field 2) resource_save network subnet_id $subnet_id local router_id router_id=$(openstack router create $NEUTRON_NET -f value -c id) resource_save network router_id $router_id neutron router-interface-add $NEUTRON_NET $subnet_id neutron router-gateway-set $NEUTRON_NET public # NOTE(vsaeinko) sleep is needed in order to setup route sleep 5 # Add a route to the baremetal network via the Neutron public router. # ironic-conductor will be able to access the ironic nodes via this new # route. local r_net_gateway # Determine the IP address of the interface (ip -4 route get 8.8.8.8) that # will be used to access a public IP on the router we created ($router_id). # In this case we use the Google DNS server at 8.8.8.8 as the public IP # address. This does not actually attempt to contact 8.8.8.8, it just # determines the IP address of the interface that traffic to 8.8.8.8 would # use. We use the IP address of this interface to setup the route. r_net_gateway=$(sudo ip netns exec qrouter-$router_id ip -4 route get 8.8.8.8 |grep dev | awk '{print $7}') sudo ip route replace $RESOURCES_FIXED_RANGE via $r_net_gateway # NOTE(vsaienko) remove connection between br-int and brbm from old setup sudo ovs-vsctl -- --if-exists del-port ovs-1-tap1 sudo ovs-vsctl -- --if-exists del-port brbm-1-tap1 create_ovs_taps $net_id # NOTE(vsaienko) move ironic VMs back to private network. local net_id net_id=$(openstack network show private -f value -c id) create_ovs_taps $net_id neutron router-gateway-clear neutron_grenade || /bin/true neutron router-interface-delete neutron_grenade neutron_grenade || /bin/true neutron router-delete neutron_grenade || /bin/true neutron net-delete neutron_grenade || /bin/true
